bill_title: Honoring Evelyn Nystrom for her outstanding and loyal service to the South Dakota House of Representatives.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Evelyn Nystrom for her outstanding and loyal service to the South Dakota House of Representatives. WHEREAS, Evelyn Nystrom served the South Dakota Legislature for a total of 28 years as the Assistant Chief of Engrossing and Enrolling from 1961 to 1965; the Chief of Engrossing and Enrolling from 1966 to 1968; the Second Assistant to the Chief Clerk from 1969 to 1972 and 1975 to 1985; and as the First Assistant to the Chief Clerk from 1986 to 1990; and WHEREAS, Evie, as she was known to all, was born in Dupree in 1931; she was a tiny woman with a twinkle in her eye and a mischievous spirit who loved the outdoors and the Minnesota Twins through their winning and losing seasons; and WHEREAS, Evie survived a bout with anthrax having contracted it from a sliver off a corral fence, and bravely battled cancer for ten years until her death on September 18, 2003; and WHEREAS, Evie is lovingly remembered by her husband, Bob, daughter, Debra, son, Brad, and all of her many friends, including those co-workers with whom she enjoyed the fun and excitement of working for the South Dakota Legislature: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Evelyn Nystrom be lovingly remembered and honored for her faithful, dedicated service to the South Dakota Legislature and the State of South Dakota.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Evelyn Nystrom for her outstanding and loyal service to the South Dakota House of Representatives. WHEREAS, Evelyn Nystrom served the South Dakota Legislature for a total of 28 years as the Assistant Chief of Engrossing and Enrolling from 1961 to 1965; the Chief of Engrossing and Enrolling from 1966 to 1968; the Second Assistant to the Chief Clerk from 1969 to 1972 and 1975 to 1985; and as the First Assistant to the Chief Clerk from 1986 to 1990; and WHEREAS, Evie, as she was known to all, was born in Dupree in 1931; she was a tiny woman with a twinkle in her eye and a mischievous spirit who loved the outdoors and the Minnesota Twins through their winning and losing seasons; and WHEREAS, Evie survived a bout with anthrax having contracted it from a sliver off a corral fence, and bravely battled cancer for ten years until her death on September 18, 2003; and WHEREAS, Evie is lovingly remembered by her husband, Bob, daughter, Debra, son, Brad, and all of her many friends, including those co-workers with whom she enjoyed the fun and excitement of working for the South Dakota Legislature: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Seventy-ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Evelyn Nystrom be lovingly remembered and honored for her faithful, dedicated service to the South Dakota Legislature and the State of South Dakota.
